channel.title: [Ruby] Arrays and Types Help
channel.description:
Just a general question:
Say I've got an instance array called @terms.
[code]current_term = @terms[rand(@terms.length)] word = current_term.get_word[/code]
I attempt to grab a random item from it. Now, it is assumed that all the items in the array are 'Term' instances, so therefore the 'current_term' variable should now be a random 'Term' instance. However, when I attempt to access the instance method 'Term.get_word', I get the following error:
[code]david@home:~/development/ruby/definition-quiz$ sh run.sh ./src/Quiz.rb:21:in `main_loop': undefined method `get_word' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError) from ./src/Quiz.rb:75 [/code]
Note - I ran 'instance_methods' on the class and the methods showed up.
Also, if you wanna check out my code and give me a few hints, that'd be appreciated :D. http://rafb.net/p/J14yok24.html
---
Ok, separate question :D. Coming from Java, I'm used to having different classes in different files. However, in Ruby, it seems people tend to have several classes in the one file. How can I access classes/methods in different classes?
